title: Week 1: Course Introduction
description: Overview of the course, expectations, and assessment methods.

title: Week 2-3: Knowing Your Data
description: Focus on data exploration, visualization, normalization, and feature extraction through hands-on labs with provided datasets.

title: Week 4: Logistic Regression
description: Introduction to logistic regression as a supervised learning technique with practical examples.

title: Week 5: Decision Trees
description: Examination of decision trees for classification and regression tasks.

title: Week 6: Random Forests and Ensemble Methods
description: Exploration of ensemble methods, particularly random forests, and their advantages in model performance.

title: Week 7: Neural Networks
description: Overview of neural networks and their applications in supervised learning.

title: Week 8: Model Evaluation Techniques
description: Discussion of various metrics for evaluating model performance, including accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and ROC-AUC.

title: Week 9: Fall Break
description: A week for reflection and revision of the materials covered so far.

title: Week 10: Clustering Techniques
description: Introduction to various clustering techniques and their applications in data mining.

title: Week 11: Dimensionality Reduction
description: Exploration of methods for reducing the dimensionality of datasets while preserving important information.

title: Week 12: Generative Models
description: Discussion of generative models and their use in unsupervised learning.

title: Week 13: Advanced Topic – Text Mining & Representation Learning
description: Focus on deep learning approaches to text mining and practical applications of text mining algorithms.

title: Week 14: Advanced Topic – Reinforcement Learning
description: Introduction to reinforcement learning concepts, applications, and basic implementations.

title: Week 15-16: Final Project Presentations
description: Students present their group projects, showcasing the data mining solutions developed throughout the course.
